title: West Community Associates: Beauty in Art and Nature
hero_caption: Mansion Gate in the Spring. Photo courtesy of Anderson Japanese Gardens.
description:
The Rockford Art Museum opened in the late 19th century. Today, it is a collection of more than 1,900 works of art, consisting of modern and contemporary American art from the 19th and 20th centuries through today.

Anderson Japanese Gardens started in 1978 in the backyard of Rockford businessman John Anderson after he visited the Portland Japanese Garden in Oregon. Donated to the Rockford Charitable Association in 1998, the gardens continue to grow and change to this day. Essential elements of stone, water, and plants are combined with secondary elements of pagodas, stone lanterns, water basins, arbors, and bridges to create an authentic Japanese garden.

Schedule of the Day:

8:15—Bus departs from Compass Church, 1551 E. Hobson Road, Naperville, IL 60540

10:00—Docent-led tour of Rockford Art Museum, located at 711 N. Main Street, Rockford, IL 61103

11:15—Bus departs for Anderson Japanese Gardens, located at 318 Spring Creek Road, Rockford, IL 61103

11:30—Lunch

1:00—Docent-led tour of the Anderson Japanese Gardens

2:30—Depart for Naperville, IL

Registration Period: April 30, 2019–May 14, 2019

To contact the event planner, please reach out to Marcia Patterson at (630) 244-4466 or marciakpatterson@gmail.com. To contact the assistant event planner, please reach out to RuthAnne Wilcox at (630) 536-8821, (630) 991-8660, or racwilcox6669.yahoo.com.

This Community Associates event is exclusively for current Community Associates members. Membership will be verified at the door, and refunds cannot be issued for those without a valid membership. For Community Associates events that allow guests, nonmember guests must be registered by a Community Associates member.

If you are interested in becoming a member of Community Associates, please visit artic.edu/joinnow to join both the Art Institute of Chicago and the Community Associates group of your choice.
location: Rockford Art Museum and Anderson Japanese Gardens, Rockford, IL
